SENT.plain: In recent years, evidence has been accumulating that tissue plasminogen activator (tPA) possesses neurotoxic effects
However, such deleterious effects have been attributed to endogenously generated tPA
In the present study, focusing on exogenously administered tPA for the purpose of fibrinolysis, we evaluated the extent and the degree of extravasated tPA in a rat model of thromboembolic stroke
Even after early recanalization of occluded cerebral vessels, significant infiltration of tPA occurred through the cerebral vessels
It is assumed that exogenous tPA also exerts neurotoxic effects in the ischemic brain tissue
